newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH FINMIN PUTS IS BOHEMIA UNDER ADMINISTRATION.
newsitem.headline: CZECH FINMIN PUTS IS BOHEMIA UNDER ADMINISTRATION.

text.p: The Czech Finance Ministry said on Tuesday it had placed fund manager Investicni Spolecnost Bohemia a.s. under forced administration after discovering it had taken actions that "threatened" shareholders.

"The reason...was serious violations of the law from the side of IS Bohemia, where the interests of shareholders are directly threatened and there is a potential danger from delay," said ministry spokeswoman Ludmila Nutilova.
She did not elaborate on the violations.
IS Bohemia manages assets worth 53 million crowns in two open-ended mutual funds.
The market oversight department at the ministry has stepped up actions recently against managers of investment and mutual funds, who have often been accused of damaging shareholders' interests.
Foreign and local analysts and investors have widely- criticised the Czech capital market due to a lack of transparency and the opaque practices of local investment groups.
